title: Comprehensive Interpretation of E-commerce: Industry, Technology, Marketing, and Operations
prompt:
1. Industry Overview
   Development of E-commerce: From early electronic data interchange to modern mobile e-commerce.
   Industry Size and Trends: Global e-commerce transaction volume, annual growth rate, future development direction.
   E-commerce Models: Characteristics and examples of B2B, B2C, C2C, C2B, O2O.

2. Core Technology
   Network Security: Encryption technology, digital certificates, anti-fraud systems.
   Payment Systems: E-wallets, online banking transfers, third-party payments.
   Website Development: Responsive design, user interface optimization, website performance improvement.

3. Marketing and Promotion
   Search Engine Marketing: Keyword optimization, advertising placement.
   Social Media Marketing: Social platform promotion strategies, influencer marketing.
   Content Marketing: Blogging, video, image and text content creation and dissemination.

4. Operations Management
   Order Management: Order processing flow, inventory synchronization.
   Customer Service: Online customer service, after-sales processing, customer satisfaction improvement.
   Logistics and Distribution: Courier selection, warehouse management, last-mile delivery.

5. Data Analysis
   Traffic Analysis: Traffic sources, user behavior paths.
   Sales Data Analysis: Sales volume, average order value, conversion rate.
   Market Research: Competitor analysis, consumer insights.

6. Legal Regulations
   Consumer Rights Protection: Return and exchange policies, privacy protection.
   E-commerce Regulations: Tax policies, platform liability provisions.

7. Emerging Areas
   Cross-border E-commerce: Customs clearance, international logistics, overseas market expansion.
   Rural E-commerce: Upward movement of agricultural products, rural logistics solutions.
   Live-streaming E-commerce: Live platform selection, host training, product display techniques.

title: E-commerce professional introduction
prompt:
1. Basic Knowledge Category
E-commerce Models: B2B (Business to Business), B2C (Business to Consumer), C2C (Consumer to Consumer), C2B (Consumer to Business), O2O (Online to Offline), etc., can be used to describe the characteristics and case studies of different types of e-commerce transaction models.
E-commerce Platforms: Taobao, JD.com, Amazon, eBay, etc., involving platform operation models, rules, and comparative advantages and disadvantages.
Online Marketing: Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Search Engine Marketing (SEM), Social Media Marketing, Email Marketing, Content Marketing, can be used to explain how various marketing methods can be used to promote products or services in e-commerce.

2. Technical Application Category
Website Development: Domain, Server, Web Design, User Experience (UX), User Interface (UI), can be used to discuss the construction and optimization of e-commerce websites.
Payment Systems: Third-party payment (Alipay, WeChat Pay, etc.), Online Banking Payment, E-wallet, involving payment security, payment processes, and the selection and optimization of payment methods.
Logistics and Delivery: Express Delivery, Warehouse Management, Supply Chain Management, Last Mile Delivery, can be used to analyze the efficiency, cost control, and service quality of e-commerce logistics.

3. Operations Management Category
Product Management: Product Listing, Delisting, Category Management, Inventory Management, Product Pricing, used to guide the operations and strategies related to products in e-commerce.
Customer Relationship Management (CRM): Customer Acquisition, Customer Retention, Customer Satisfaction, Loyalty Programs, can be used to study how to maintain and enhance relationships with e-commerce customers.
Data Analysis: Traffic Analysis, Conversion Rate Analysis, User Behavior Analysis, Sales Data Analysis, can be used to make e-commerce operational decisions based on data.

4. Legal and Regulatory Category
Consumer Rights Protection: Return and Exchange Policies, Product Quality Assurance, Privacy Protection, used to ensure the legitimate rights of consumers in e-commerce transactions.
E-commerce Law: Electronic Contracts, Intellectual Property Protection, Online Transaction Regulation, can be used to regulate the business practices of e-commerce enterprises and avoid legal risks.

5. Development Trends Category
Cross-border E-commerce: Cross-border Logistics, Customs Clearance, International Payments, Market Access, used to study the expansion of e-commerce in international markets.
Mobile E-commerce: Mobile Apps, Mobile Payments, Mobile Marketing, Responsive Design, can be used to analyze the development characteristics and trends of e-commerce in the mobile internet era.
Integration of Emerging Technologies and E-commerce: Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, Virtual Reality (VR), Augmented Reality (AR), can be used to discuss how these technologies are changing the business models and operations of e-commerce.

title: Wealth management planning
prompt:
Here is the translation of your text:

Below is a template for introducing the Wealth Management major:

**1. Overview of the Major**

Wealth Management is a comprehensive discipline focusing on the planning, management, and enhancement of personal and institutional wealth. It integrates knowledge from various fields such as finance, economics, accounting, and law, aiming to cultivate wealth management professionals with professional competence and practical skills.

**2. Training Objectives**

This major aims to equip students with a solid theoretical foundation in wealth management, familiarity with various financial instruments and investment strategies, and the ability to provide personalized wealth management solutions for clients. Students will possess good communication, analytical, and decision-making skills, enabling them to work in wealth management-related positions in financial institutions such as banks, securities firms, insurance companies, trusts, as well as corporate finance departments and professional wealth management firms.

**3. Curriculum Structure**

1. Core Courses
   - Principles of Economics
   - Fundamentals of Accounting
   - Introduction to Finance
   - Financial Management
   - Statistics
2. Major Core Courses
   - Investment Management
   - Securities Investment Analysis
   - Principles of Insurance
   - Financial Risk Management
   - Introduction to Wealth Management
   - Tax Planning
   - Estate Planning
   - Trusts and Asset Management
3. Practical Courses
   - Financial Simulation Trading
   - Financial Planning Practice
   - Case Analysis and Discussion
   - Internship and Graduation Project

**4. Special Features of the Major**

1. Emphasis on Practical Teaching: Through simulation trading, practical courses, and internships, students will acquire practical operational skills in wealth management.
2. Personalized Training: Providing diversified elective courses and professional directions based on students' interests and career plans to meet the needs of different students.
3. School-Enterprise Cooperation: Establishing close cooperation with financial institutions, wealth management companies, etc., to provide students with internship and employment opportunities, as well as inviting industry experts to give lectures and guidance.
4. International Perspective: Introducing advanced international wealth management concepts and methods, offering bilingual courses to cultivate students' international perspectives and cross-cultural communication skills.

**5. Career Paths**

1. Financial Institutions: Wealth management departments of banks, securities firms, insurance companies, trusts, etc., engaging in roles such as financial advisors, investment managers, client managers, etc.
2. Corporate Finance Departments: Responsible for corporate financial management and investment decisions, conducting fund operations and risk control.
3. Professional Wealth Management Institutions: Independent financial advisory firms, wealth management companies, etc., providing comprehensive wealth management services to clients.
4. Government Departments and Public Institutions: Engaged in financial regulation, financial management, and related work.

**6. Career Development Prospects**

With the development of the economy and the continuous accumulation of wealth, the demand for the wealth management industry is growing. Graduates of the Wealth Management major have broad employment prospects and good career development opportunities. They can continuously enhance their professional level in the financial field to become senior wealth management experts, or choose to start their own financial institutions. Additionally, with the development of financial technology, the wealth management industry is constantly innovating and changing, providing more opportunities and challenges for professional talents.

title: Automotive technology service and marketing
prompt:
The Automotive Technology Service and Marketing major combines the fields of automotive technology and marketing into a comprehensive professional program.

Overview:
This major aims to cultivate applied talents who understand both automotive technology and possess marketing capabilities. Through their studies, students can master professional knowledge in automotive construction, performance, testing, and also proficiently apply marketing strategies and techniques to provide professional support for sales and after-sales services in automotive enterprises.

Courses:
Automotive Technology Courses:
- Automotive Construction: Understanding various components of a car, including the engine, chassis, body, electrical equipment, laying the foundation for future technical service and marketing work.
- Automotive Electronics Technology: Learning the principles and maintenance methods of automotive electronic control systems, such as engine control, chassis control, body control, etc.
- Automotive Inspection and Maintenance: Mastering basic skills in diagnosing and repairing automotive faults, capable of performing daily maintenance and inspections on vehicles.

Marketing Courses:
- Marketing Studies: Learning the basic theories and methods of marketing, including market research, market positioning, product strategy, pricing strategy, channel strategy, and promotion strategy.
- Automotive Marketing Practices: Studying the sales process and techniques in the automotive industry, such as customer development, needs analysis, product introduction, test drives, negotiation, and closing deals.
- Automotive Service Marketing: Focusing on marketing in the automotive after-sales service sector, including the content, process, and marketing strategies of after-sales service to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty.

Career Paths:
Automotive Sales Positions:
- Automotive 4S Store Sales Consultant: Responsible for car sales, providing professional advice and services to customers, and achieving sales targets.
- Automotive Sales Manager: Managing the automotive sales team, developing sales plans and strategies to improve sales performance.

Automotive After-Sales Service Positions:
- Automotive After-Sales Service Consultant: Welcoming customers, answering questions about car repairs, maintenance, etc., arranging repair tasks, monitoring repair progress to ensure customer satisfaction.
- Automotive Maintenance Technician: Responsible for car maintenance and repair work, possessing solid automotive technical knowledge and repair skills.

Automotive Marketing Positions:
- Marketing Specialist: Responsible for automotive market research, event planning and execution to increase brand awareness and product sales.
- Public Relations Specialist: Managing relationships between the company and media, the public to enhance corporate image and brand reputation.

Professional Advantages:
- Broad Employment Prospects: With the rapid development of the automotive industry, the demand for talents in automotive technology service and marketing continues to increase. Graduates can find employment in various fields such as automotive manufacturing companies, automotive sales companies, and automotive after-sales service companies.
- Strong Comprehensive Skills: This major integrates knowledge and skills in automotive technology and marketing, cultivating students with strong comprehensive qualities and competitiveness.
- Rich Practical Teaching: The professional curriculum emphasizes practical teaching, allowing students to master automotive technology service and marketing skills through internships and practical training.

title: Create a humorous introduction to automotive technology services and marketing.
prompt:
Hey, everyone! I am a student majoring in automotive technology services and marketing. Today, I'm here to talk to you about our super cool major.

In this major, we are like the "all-around talents" training ground in the automotive industry. Stepping into this major feels like embarking on a super cool adventure in the world of cars.

Let's start with automotive technology. Hey, we are not just about driving cars! We need to investigate the structure of cars like little detectives. We need to understand everything about engines, transmissions, chassis, and more. Imagine in the future when a friend's car has a problem, we can easily diagnose and fix it, earning their admiration. We are like the "Sherlock Holmes" of the automotive world, spotting any car trouble with our keen eyes.

Now, let's talk about marketing. Wow, it's like an exciting car sales battle. We need to learn how to sell these "steel beasts." Imagine yourself as a super car salesperson, eloquently introducing the cool features and advantages of cars to customers. Using humorous and creative marketing techniques, we make customers willingly drive the car home.

Moreover, we also need to learn about car insurance and claims. If a customer's car has an issue, we need to swiftly appear like car insurance angels to solve their problems. "Don't worry, with us here, insurance claims are a breeze, and your beloved car will be back on the road in no time!"

In this major, practical classes are particularly interesting. We will intern at car dealerships to experience real car sales and service scenarios. Sometimes, we even attend car exhibitions, feeling thrilled by the shiny luxury cars. It's like standing at the peak of the automotive world.

In conclusion, automotive technology services and marketing is a challenging and fun major. Here, we can become automotive technology experts and marketing gurus. In the future, we will shine in the world of cars and make more people fall in love with these "steel treasures"!
